intro: Thibaudia ovata, commonly known as the oval thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Thibaudia ovata prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun exposure.
